How to Get Chevening Scholarship 2024

The application process for the prestigious Chevening Scholarships at King’s College London is now open, inviting eligible and qualified students to apply. This highly sought-after scholarship opportunity provides fully-funded awards to exceptional individuals with a drive to become future leaders. Successful applicants will receive support to pursue one-year taught master’s degrees at renowned UK institutions for the academic session of 2024. The Chevening Scholarships program is globally inclusive, welcoming applications from more than 160 countries and territories worldwide.

Scholarship Overview

Scholarship Sponsor(s): Chevening Scholarships King’s College London, UK

Host Institution(s): King’s College London, UK

Scholarship Worth: Fully-funded

Number of Awards: Several

Study Level: Masters

Nationality: International Students

About the Chevening Scholarships for International Students

The Chevening Scholarships offer a transformative experience for international students, providing fully-funded opportunities that enable recipients to focus on their professional goals and make the most of a life-changing journey. As a Chevening Scholar, you will have the chance to live and study in the UK for a year, immersing yourself in a supportive academic environment while nurturing personal and professional growth.

During your time in the UK, you will have unparalleled opportunities to enhance your professional and academic skills, expand your network extensively, immerse yourself in UK culture, and forge lasting, positive relationships with the UK community. By the end of your studies, you will depart equipped with the knowledge, insights, and networks necessary to bring your own ideas to life and make a meaningful impact in your field.

Eligibility Criteria

To be eligible for Chevening Scholarships for International Students, applicants are expected to meet the following conditions:

  • Applicants must be a citizen of a Chevening-eligible country or territory.
  • Return to your country of citizenship for a minimum of two years after their award has ended.
  • Have completed all components of an undergraduate degree that will enable entry onto a postgraduate programme at a UK university by the time they submit their application. This is typically equivalent to an upper second-class 2:1 honours degree in the UK but may be different depending on the course and university choice.
  • Have at least two years (equivalent to 2,800 hours) of work experience.
  • Apply to three different eligible UK university courses and have received an unconditional offer from one of these choices by the Chevening deadline.

Scholarship Benefits

Successful applicants for Chevening Scholarships for International Students will receive the following benefits:

  • Chevening scholarships are fully-funded,
  • Covering flights,
  • Accommodation, and
  • Course fees

Application Procedures

How-to-Apply: Interested applicants seeking for Chevening Scholarships for International Students are notify that Applications are made direct to Chevening. For full details and to apply, please visit the Chevening website.

Selection Process

The process of selecting Chevening Scholars takes a minimum of eight months from the application deadline to when applicants are conditionally selected for an award.

If you have a general enquiry about Chevening Awards, please visit their website here.
